posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53090392
>Wish it had more variation in wild Pokemon though.
I personally liked it, from a design standpoint at least.
No horrifying mutants, or eldritch horrors. Just happy, peaceful Pokemon and flourishing plant life bathed in sunlight. It's seemingly just the same as everywhere else.
Contrasts against all you've heard about this terrifying land, one that's taken one life that you know of, where the titan you fought before came from.
Nothing to fear, right?
And yet, something *is* wrong. If there's clouds above you, wheres the light coming from?
And your legendary, why won't they come out of their ball?

>>53090589
There's multiple pokemon whose dex entries imply they can kill people, so some nameless guy from 100 years age having gotten killed by the paradox pokemon didn't strike me as particularly shocking. However, I wasn't expecting the reveal that this gen's professor character and one of the main NPCs' parent turned out to have been dead the whole time after getting killed by a pokemon you would later have to fight. Also, instead of the usual typical pokemon logic where the bad guy challenges you into a pokemon fight and just drops his evil plans after you beat him, the implication was that the AI professor would've straight up commanded his/her 'Raidon to murder you if it hadn't been for your 'Raidon saving the day at the last moment.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>53091000
This is my take too.
Mysteries before felt like they were either not thought about much in the first place or never meant to be fleshed out. The Gen 5 original dragon is obviously supposed to be an idea, not an actual thing, and stuff like Zygarde or the powerplant in X/Y were present, but were never really hinted at or presented like something will actually happen.

IN S/V we have the Beast trio and the musketeer trio fusion, Arven specifically points out how things dont make sense as if the story is yet to be completed, the disc legendary is weirdly fleshed out, the expedition is designed to bring up some questions etc.
The devs clearly intend to go somewhere with this, and if they don't then I will assume it was an executive decision from higher up that prevented them from doing so.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53091074
It differs, I feel.
You always get the impression that the pokedex entries are exaggerating, because they're so dissonant with the ingame Pokemon. All of these supposedly horrifying man-eating beasts are sitting down to sandwich picnics and letting you wash them with a mareep-shaped sponge.
In S/V, though, you can catch a Pokemon which the game straight up admits has a body count.
Not a vague sentence about how they eat kids or can destroy entire towns or something.
It just tells you that it physically killed an established in game character, with the death having in game consequences
Makes it feel more grounded.

>>53080332
None of that implies anything. It doesn't imply relationships, it's simply just written word in the pokedex, which as noted by Masuda may even be ignored if it gets in the way of how they want to portray Pokémon.

Pokémon as intended represent the critters Tajiri interacted with in his childhood while also doubling as good pets in the vain of cats and dogs, something he mentioned and made clear in his 2018 biography but also as early as 1995.

As Takeshi Shudo wrote, the anime staff, which in the planning stages would have likely involved Pokémon creators, decided to think of Pokémon as being like critter from the real world. Shudo in his blog even introduces Pokémon this way, as group of critters inspired by familiar objects and creatures. This is even the viewpoint given to us in the 2012 guide which explicitly tells us Pokémon replace the critters from the real world, and note that it never mentions monsters except not to call Pokémon that.

The series itself is even starting to reject the label monster for Pokémon and SV has dialogue to dissociate the label from Pokémon. Given that the series constructs domesticated Pokémon to be like dogs and cats, both in the way they're treated and how the act, and given that they also want people to view Pokémon as cute little critters and not monsters no one should act shocked when there's a push back against sexualization of what are essentially innocent creatures that occupy the sphere of being a pet and also being natural creatures. That perception lies in the way the series has chosen to construct Pokémon.

Yes. Gengar for example isn't depicted as a lonely entity that's going to harms you or kill you as the pokedex implies. Ash's Gengar, for example, was depicted as an abandoned dog, one commentator on reddit called the debut episode the 'Jurassic Bark' of Pokémon.

You're trying to paint Tajiri as a deviant when evidence suggests that you're wrong on all counts. First because his biography is pretty open of how he thinks of Pokémon. This panel here shows that he thinks of them as being like cats and dogs which is a viewpoint that is reinforced in the following panels as he imagines Pokémon battles as two dog owners in the real world allowing their dogs to fight, according to him the angles Pokémon fights are drawn in are inspired by this. In short it clearly cements his statement. And this isn't something that materialized out of the blue, the 1996 Pokedex guide written by GameFreak has this in one of their sections:

More fearsome than a cat, more kind than kaiju, those are pokemon
People quickly think of Pokemon to be like Kaiju. There's a strong image of Kaiju being evil, but in this world there isn't such a thing. They're friends to humans like dogs and cats.

Tajiri even wrote something similar in 1995 in a book recovered by Dr. Lava. Takeshi Shudo talks about some of these things in his blog as well, for example how they decided Pokémon would eat berries and Pokémon food, basically what visually looks exactly like dry dog food, among other things during the planning stages of the anime.

I appreciate your setting out a coherent, source-based argument. Rare few do on this website.
You are correct in that Tajiri did not intend for either the overt humanisation or sexualisation of Pokémon. Attempts to say otherwise are wrong.
However, over time, the franchise has changed into one where this is arguably the case, that is, the humanisation of Pokemon.
This is partially due to the anime; which, in the name of consistent plotlines, has involved Pokemon as more active characters than bystanders or plot devices.
Most notably of course is Meowth. This is largely for comedic effect, of course, and due to his appearance in early seasons, where the lore was taken far more liberally, should be taken with a grain of salt.
However, various talking, intelligent have appeared since, taking direct, more dramatic roles. Case in point the Lucario in M08, which displays eminent and human characteristics.
As for other examples, the Ninetales seen in "Just waiting for a friend", the Zoroark in "The island of illusions", and the Malamar which frequently appeared in X&Y(Whilst it never talks directly, one can infer its hypnotising of Jenny and blatant intelligence as implying it could if it wanted to)
Admittedly, this is not as present in the games, their focus being on gameplay over story, with the legendaries being the only real exception.
However, we do still see several instances of Pokemon behaving decidedly unlike docile pets or wild animals. The two disguised zoroarks in Lostlorn forest, for instance.
Overall, we can assume GF's stance on pokemon's mental capabilities as being whatever's convenient at a given time. They are intentionally kept vague for narrative ease.
This results in amusing situations such as Sawk or Mr Mime, about as human as Pokémon get, eating from dog bowls on the ground

I will also exclude the Sinnoh legend book, as it can be open to various interpretations, i.e that Humans and Pokemon were the same species once.
Cases such as the "Machamp fan club", and NPC claiming that her mightyena is her "boyfriend" will also be disregarded, as they are an arguably comedic piece, and a questionably sincere throwaway line, respectively.
Despite all this, there is one clear cut case; the Froslass in Pokemon: Legends Arceus, who married a human, and possibly had two snorunt children with him.
(While I lack it, there is a compilation of journal entries and other in-game information which explains this further. If someone could post it, I'd be sorely appreciative.)
Granted, this is, more than anything, is a reference to the mythical Yuki-onna, by which Froslass is inspired.
However, if we are to apply this same logic to other Pokemon inspired by mythology, that is that they will inherit traits of their respective legend, then this means that any other mythology-inspired pokemon will perform sexual acts their mythological inspiration would.
To refer to a previous example; Ninetales and Zoroark. Both are inspired by Kitsune, and ergo, would behave much as one does. Due to the noted seductress tendencies of Kitsune (As well as some who form more lasting romantic relationships with humans), we can assume that these two, due to their ability to assume human form (See; Ninetales in "Just waiting for a friend", Zoroark in most depictions), they may also attempt this.
Ergo, while not nearly to the extent which /vp/ threads like to pretend, and with an admittedly restricted amount of Pokémon (The amount of which can be debated), there is accounts of sexual relations between humans and Pokemon.

The former falls more under being a humanoid dancer, while Flamigo seems like it would be more in line with a secretary bird and fall into a similar vein as Mankey, where it's an animal that can use make use of punches and kicks, rather than being a full-on humanoid.

Designs like Paldean Tauros, Slither Wing, Great Tusk, and Koraidon strike me much more as outliers. All of them seem like they're using Fighting type purely in the context of being muscular.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53079820
>Designs like Paldean Tauros, Slither Wing, Great Tusk, and Koraidon strike me much more as outliers. All of them seem like they're using Fighting type purely in the context of being muscular.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53080642
I don't even think it'd be impossible to salvage some of them.
Koraidon in particular could easily be tweaked with Dex entries that imply a greater degree of actual fighting technique, like saying it used to wrestle with ancient monsters, or was rumored to have taught early warriors how to fight. Perhaps at least some sort of Aura connection if they were feeling lazy. Being able to get Aura Sphere from a TM, even if it's off only 80 special attack, would at least imply a greater connection there.

Paldean Tauros in turn could potentially work if greater emphasis was placed on the idea of bull-fighting with it, and giving it the attitude of the matador rather than the raging bull. Swap out Anger point for another ability and give it moves like Counter and Detect that put a focus on it being more cautious. That still isn't great, but as it stands Paldean Tauros is just described as muscular and fierce, which is the same as most other Tauros dex entries.

Slither Wing and Great Tusk should have types changed entirely. I would say Bug/Ground for the former, since Earthquake or Stomping Tantrum is still plenty primal. Then perhaps Ground/Normal for the latter, to let it represent that brute force with powerful STAB normal attacks, or if Gamefreak really wanted to avoid Normal type Paradox mons, then I could also see Ground/Dark, focusing on moves like Brutal Swing or Knock Off as a way to represent it being a highly aggressive brute.

While I do think it is possible to have Fighting types that aren't just humanoid martial artists, it feels like little to no effort was made to try and justify it for some of Gen 9's designs.

>>53090817
The problem isn't who it can be learned from. It's a natural move that you can teach it as soon as Wartortle evolves into Blastoise. Things like this are usually the starter's signature in the later generation, some even related to the second type (Fighting from Blaziken's Blaze Kick, Ground from Torterra's Earthquake, etc.). The fact that GF brought it in and not any other confirmed it was the one that suited Blastoise best (probably because Blastoise's cannon is made of steel).

If I want to talk about Squirtle's genuine signature, I must mention Skull Bash in Gen II. In Gen I, It can be learned only by Squirtle line via level-up. You can teach it to others but only through TM40. It matches the turtle's habit of withdrawing its head inside the shell, so turtles learn it naturally.

posts.com: Thoughts on the Academy segment of SV? Was it a fun new addition or was it as boring as Pokestar Studios?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I completed the whole thing just to see where it was going.
- History is unironically interesting, you get a lot of Paldea lore.
- Maths I think it's great for a beginner, an experimented player is probably getting bored. It's actually interesting that for the first time they officially acknowledged the critical ratio (1/24). During leak season the rumor was that it was nerfed and the game itself steps up to dispel the rumor.
- Same for Biology, he teaches things like breeding that you likely googled but a small kid won't.
- Battle once again gives some concepts that are good for beginners and not so much for veterans. There was a class that helped me understanding how the online battle modes work, since I was a bit outdated in that regard. Also Dendra is gorgeous.
- Art gave a short introduction to Tera jewel designs, he also talks about the restaurant to change tera types and about the Ten Sights.
- Home Ec is kinda forgettable, I had to google again its content. Once again, things like berries' usage that are useful for kids but not for internet savvy players.
- Languages is fucking useless, but eh, raid cat.

(EX: Player is a Bug Catcher so they have an active turn to set up sticky web for free and a passive 10% dmg boost)

posts.com:
Remove per move PP and make it a pool per pokemon per battle. Moves now cost 1-8 PP, Each mon has 8 PP pool, restores 2 each turn.

Instead of choosing a move, you can now dodge, block, and throw partners (in non single battles).
Moves never miss unless the opponent dodges.
Blocking reduces received damage.

All types now have statuses associated with them. Each type gets a buff and debuff status effect.

IVs are removed.

Flying is now Wind type.
Pokemon that can fly, float, glide or levitate are in a state of being in the air unless they are grounded. Being in the air makes a mon weak to electric type attacks.
Electric is neutral against Wind types that are not in the air.

Pokemon can have any type as a mutation, and this is 1000x rarer than shinies.
Mutated pokemon have pallete swaps according to their type e.g. fire type pikachu is red/orange.

You can upgrade a pokemon's BST a certain number of times, more if they are initially weak e.g. Caterpie, less or not at all if they are initially strong e.g. Mewtwo.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53088349
There absolutely is unpredictability
Every time a batter swings he's going for a home run. But the unpredictability of how and where he hits the ball, the condition of the ball, the wind, whatever wobble imparted onto the ball by the pitcher unconsciously, results in a fairly random outcome in terms of where the ball goes.

Poker is larger than chess by far.
But beyond that, there's a reason that high level chess players like Bobby Fischer talk shit about how predictable and uninteresting chess becomes.
Which is where you get Fischer Random chess and the like. Because RNG makes things better and more skill based.

Not even being a Temtem stan or anything but literally just Temtem's system minus Hold turns. All rng is removed, statuses can be stacked but only two at a time and all of them last for set amount of turns. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53087620
>Go to pokemon menu
>Select pokemon
>Click options in bottom right
>Click "appraise"
IV values range from 0 to 15 in each stat. Because PvP uses the fucked up Combat Power system, you want low attack, high defense, and high hit point IVs if you plan to use it in PvP. For PvE, you want it maxed out. If you trade a pokemon, its IVs get rerolled and you have another chance at good IVs, which is why people max out the 100/day trade limit after community days and spotlight hours. Also, "lucky" pokemon have minimum IV values of 12/12/12.

Purifying a pokemon removes the incredible 20% damage boost from its "shadow bonus" in exchange for +2 on each IV stat, which is not even remotely worth it. The only reasons to purify a pokemon is if they benefit more from gaining Return, if you NEED to be able to mega evolve that one in particular, or if you plan to trade it, since you can't trade shadow pokemon. You can also purify shadow shitmons to help build your "purifier" medal, but you don't want to d9 that to pokemon that are actually good.

>>53090605
Lilligant doesn't get much art either. it gets less than Tsareena and scores lower on Smash or Pass sites.

But what do you mean by popular for one? Tsareena is certainly well liked on the front that people want to "smash" it. Number 10 here with a 64% smash rate out of 90k people. It has a 73% smash rate in PokeSmash but PokeSmash way of doing things makes it hard to gauge because it goes by dex order instead of being random like in rule34.xxx. What you get is 500k votes for gen I to a little over 100k by Calyrex. Meanwhile rule34.xxx is more consistent with a range of 88k to 90k. But overall doesn't indicate that people don't like it.

If you mean porn drawn than yeah, people don't draw porn of it that much. Compared to Lycanroc, almost 5k compared to Tsareena's 730. In fact there's quiet a few Pokémon that have good smash rates but poor porn count and growth.

Here I was using PokeSmash as a base of comparison but you can use rule34.xxx smash or pass for cross-reference too. The image to the right details porn growth in the span of four months from September 1st to January 1st. As you can see Tsareena, Liligant, Milotic, Meloetta, Hatterene, and Primarina suffer low growth despite having decent placings in either Pokesmash or rule34.xxx or even both.

But there's few Pokémon with both consistency in smashability and porn growth. Gardevoir, the eeveelutions, Lopunny, Braixen/Delphox and Zoroark are the most consistent Pokémon in both categories. I don't think enough people give Zoroark credit for it's consistency.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The Electric Treecko looks too much like a ... Well, Electric Type Treecko. It's not even subtle.

I don't like the feel most of these monsters give me, which is fair if the Xenoverse team is behind it, considering I dislike most Xenoverse fakemon (not a fan of Xenoverse in generale either, it's the usual edgy pretentious fangame shit).

The art style of this new game looks pretty bad, it's like it cannot decide what it is. The 2D sprites on such 3D environments look like they're glued on the background, it doesn't feel cohesive at all and it breaks immersion.
I haven't played much of Octopath Traveler but I feel that there it works better because while the overworld leans more towards 3D, it still retains the pixelated aesthetic in a way that makes the whole world believable enough.

All in all, I have no faith in this project, any game that presents itself as the "next Pokémon rival" ends up being garbage.
And do you know why?
Because you guys focus your efforts on it being "better than Pokémon uwu" rather than giving your work its own identity.

You have no creativity and would rather piggyback on a 20+ years old franchise that is sinking like Titanic because you don't have enough creativity to actually create the next big thing without scavenging someone else's work.

The team behind Xenoverse is pretentious and overrated as hell, I can admire them as programmers and artists, but they have the creativity of an embarrassingly edgy 12 years old boy, which is far from being a compliment.

>they'd likely all be rounded up
Good luck trying to, well, catch 'em all.
You'd have larvitar constantly emerging from the ground in the middle of nowhere, and subsequently evolving into walking WMD's.
Every landfill would become a hotbed for enormous hordes of trubbish and garbodor to emerge. Apex regional landfill in Las Vegas gets 3.8 million tonnes of garbage every year. Thats 38,000 garbodors.
Magikarp can exist in nearly any environment, no matter how foul or polluted. You'd feel a rattle from the sewer below you, then a newly evolved gyrados would come bursting out.
A lot of ghost Pokemon just seem to... manifest from nothing.
As for training, I could see certain intelligent Pokémon willingly forming an alliance with humanity, even without the Pokeballs.
Much more of a mercenary "You give me food and shelter and I will fight for you" kind of deal, though, where the trainer has not nearly so much power.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53083071
>Maybe, or Pokémon just aren't violent? I mean same goes for real world animals, most are passive unless u go into their territory or threaten their children, most will run away from u.

NTA, but even acknowledging the parallel between IRL animals and Pokemon, animals can be violent, whether in the wild or under human care. I can't even imagine what territorial conflicts between Pokemon and IRL pre-existing animals would be like, let alone territorial conflicts between Pokemon or between Pokemon and humans looking to exploit whatever natural resource they're sitting on.
I think the argument is that even if we imagine the most ideal situation possible, ie humans don't exploit Pokemon or use them as weapons on an institutional level, violence will inevitably happen due to some incident or other. Even assuming every trainer has the world's and the Pokemon's best interest at heart and strive to do good everywhere, accidents happen.

A single incident of Pokemon violence would be devastating on a scale that currently doesn't exist anywhere other than humans, even more so if a powerful enough specimen is unfortunately involved. We can all easily imagine what the human response would be.

Personally I think the most dangerous thing that could happen long-term is trainers trying to over-optimize Pokemon through selective breeding and ending up with a reality bending powerhouse with the flighty temperament of an Arabian racehorse.

>>53082646
This. In the case of HGSS, I think it’s only better than GSC when it comes to the post game. If I ever make a romhack, it’s going to be a simple edit of GSC featuring:

>1
All Gen 2 mon (aside from Larvitar line) available in Johto; all mon available without trades.

>2
Stat fixes. Sneasel is complete shit for having unusable STAB. Kingler could use some SPA. Hypno was gutted by the special stat split. Some mon are simply shit (Ledian is actually better than yanma kek). Many such cases.

>3
Reusable TMs and removable HMs.

>4
Higher level mon in some areas. I can’t recall ever needing to grind, but this would be handy for swapping team composition.

That’s all I feel like GSC needs, realistically. I know there are ways to modify/improve the box system now, but I’m unsure if that could still be played without emulation.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53089024
The probpem isn't being just too easy or hard. It's the game itself being inconsistent. For the first ~4 gyms, it works out pretty evenly, maybe easy if you don't have a full team, but then after Morty the levels drop out from under you, and depending on what you did early the result in gyms 5-7 is different:
> 1. Only had one/a few pokemon:
your team is probably at a higher level, you don't gain levels very much anymore, but you're already strong enough to quickly sweep through
> 2. already had 6:
Your team is even more likely to stop gaining experience ,but you also are about at the npc levels, so it's just low power STAB spam thanks to the weaker movepools unevolved/lower level mons generally have
>3. had a few, adding to the team:
the worst of both worlds, you have a few pokemon that are strong and can sweep, but any new additions will be weak and won't gain levels, so you're stuck with whatever it has when you catch it

Depending on which situation you're in, either you get to Clair and the league at their level and continue without much issue (this would be option 1), or your team is now relatively underleveled and still mot at their full potential, so it's more boring battles or grinding against the routes to get those last evos/moves (this is usually options 2 and 3)

And then no matter which one you were this time, you get to Kanto, the gyms are weaker, and it's just a casual walk around the region to destroy everything before being 10-20 levels under Red.

Other regions avoid this inconsistency thanks to the exp all, which does make them easy, but also much more well rounded to allow different playstyles instead of having drasitcally different experiences depending on when you caught your party.

Anon, you’re playing GSC wrong and bitching at randoms online about it. Donphan is really good; it crushes the game with a moveset you can have locked in by Goldenrod (with only one STAB move). Stop obsessing over STAB because it’s often bad in GSC due to Game Freak’s retardation (see: Sneasel kek). Physical attackers are good because normal attacks are good (TM Headbutt, TM Return). >1-4 strong mon
This is effectively “easy mode”. You will be at / near boss levels, and you should crush them due to badge boosts.

>party of 6

>swapping out party members

>>53088285
>and that would be venom, not poison

No, that would be poison. Venom needs to be injected into the blood stream to cause any damage. Poison can be effective topically, inhaled, ingested, or injected. You can drink snake venom and be fine (generally), but doing the same with poison would kill you. Seeing as togepi just releases this into the air, it would be poison. This is why poison arrow frogs are called such, they secrete poisons and if you touch them you will die.

posts.com: I'm excited and nervous about starting Emerald after finishing Crystal. Do you guys particularly concerned with Natures/Abilities/EVs or do you just roll with the punches?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53027277
Depends on the encounter and game state, some pokemon become liabilities with a bad nature, IVs, and movepool; like -SpA Ralts with poor SpA IVs. While fine as a Gardevoir later on due to the huge Base Stat it won't be strong enough to get there as a normal party member considering it's after the fourth badge. Then at the point where you could level it up to use it, you'll have access to other pokemon, hopefully ones with better stat distributions.

Some notable ones with the issue are
>Treecko
The worst starter in terms of early-mid game
>Poochyena
Without a decent Atk/SpA, won't do enough damage until you it before Wattson. Has Howl but is way too frail to use it. Mightyena has some utility however.
>Beautifly
Too weak and limited in moves to handle poor offensive stats
>Lombre and Nuzleaf
They need stats to balance out their awful movepools
>Ralts
As stated above

Then there's the inverse
>Mudkip and Torchic
Decent moves, coverage, and resistances balance out poor stats
>Zigzagoon
Has pick Up and gets early Headbutt which is a STAB 70 power move with a flinch chance, that with Sand-Attack, Tail Whip and Growl gives a way to set up for other pokemon
>Taillow and Wingull
Access to early Wing Attack and Water gun, respectively, are extremely useful and strong.
>Dustox
It doesn't rely on its stats as it's focused on status and support

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
This one cut a little closer than it should have, but 10th game in the challenge is done

Lorelei and Bruno were dealt with Calm Mind sweeps from Slowbro, then instead of risking it through the status effects that Agatha tried to put me through, I pulled out Substitute Raticate. Deny status effects then sweep with Shadow Ball

Things didn't go as planned vs Lance, though. Blogpost incoming
>lead Butterfree to sleep Gyarados so Slowbro can setup
>Gyarados immediately wakes up
>to kill Gyarados and the incoming Dragonair but now Slowbro is at 1/3
>swap to Nidoking
>ice beam city
>freezes Dragonite
>promptly thaws and kills Nidoking with a crit Outrage
Ninetales dealt the final blow but that sucked, now I'm missing a lot of coverage and bulk vs Rival

>lead Raticate vs Pidgeot
>TWave then set up sub on Sand Attack
>kill with Return
>kill Alakazam with Shadow Ball
>Exeggutor comes in and TWave'd
>switch Slowbro and Calm Mind twice
>Ice Beam the eggs
>Gyarados comes in
>crits Bite twice
>leaves me at 20 HP
>in a panic, misplay and switch out, should have just sacrificed him for a free switch
>send out Butterfree
>Toxic then Protect/Psychic until we're both in the red
>predict his Full Restore and put him to sleep in the same turn (felt really good about this one)
>swap into Raticate and set up another sub, then kill with Return
>Charizard comes out and Fire Blasts the sub away
>swap into Ninetales and absorb his next Fire Blast with Flash Fire
>for some reason it Fire Blasts again while I confuse and slowly chip it with HP Electric
>Rhydon comes in
>can't safely switch into anything since Rock Tomb or EQ will kill
>confuse and burn before going down
>send out Raticate
>sub for safety and kill with Return

I had plenty of misplays (including not bringing a 6th to E4) but some of my predictions left me feeling really good, and I can't feel too bad by going all the way with Raticate and Butterfree lol. Rest easy, Mr. Nido and Azsakano.

posts.com:
Clair time, after an excessively long and pointless Rocket and grinding session.
Plan? Lead Parasect, Spore Gyarados and sucks him dry I guess.
Clair decides to do the unthinkable for a Pokemon AI, and switches to Dragonair. I figure this is the fire-breathing one, which is why I led with Parasect to begin with, switching to Magcargo, getting the KO with two AncientPowers.
Kingdra next, I try to switch back to Parasect in hopes of more Sleep spreading, but take too much damage from Not Hydro Pump.
No problem, Miltank can stall as long as is needed and eventually win.
Gyarados comes back in, I switch to Sudowoodo, get a Rock Slide miss after which Gyarados waves up and deals notable damage before falling to a more successful Rock Slide.
Second Dragonair comes out, at which point I go to Girafarig, failing to get the kill due to Paralysis before going back to Mommy Milkers for a lossless win.

Did not go ideally, but good enough.

E4.

>Bruno
Leading with Parasect for Spore, then switching to Girafarig and NOT Baton Passing fast legs to the mushroom was a mistake, as Girafarig is unable to one-shot the musclemen. After therefore losing both Girafarig and Parasect to this critical error, being the only two Pokemon that can deal with Fighting-types, Miltank takes down the rest of the crew, notably the Hitmonchan who can't get through Sub Milk.
>Karen

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53072163
>Lance
I had a plan for this involving Agility Passing for the Mamoswine sweep, unfortunately that was no longer an option.
So before the battle, I give Miltank Thunderbolt, and Mamoswine Ice Beam.
Miltank leads, and it turns out, Gyarados struggles with SubMilk too, eventually falling to weather phenomena caused by a cow. Something about Greek mythology goes here.
Unfortunately, this is where it all goes downhill. I need to get Mamoswine in safely, but Miltank can't tank the strongest of the Dragonites indefinitely. Eventually I'm forced to switch in hopes of Outrage hitting in confusion, going to Sudowoodo instead, as probably the most expendable of the team.
He's able to Rock Slide the Dragonite, leading to the second one to come in. I'm not sure which one it is, so I stay in. Turns out it went for Thunder, which would've been a safe switch for Mamoswine. RIP Sudowoodo, your sacrifice won't be forgotten.
Mamoswine puts the DNite to ice, leading to Charizard.
I chose to believe Ancient Power would KO. I was wrong. Should've switched to Magcargo. Two hits was still enough, but Mamoswine is at critical health.
And Lance elects to throw out Dragonite instead of Aerodactyl.
So Lance is down to just Aerodactyl now. I switch to Magcargo here, not wanting to lose Mamoswine, and then go for Yawn. Magcargo lives at critical health, and it's clear that a sack is needed. In the end, while it's certainly the wrong choice in terms of future success, it's time for the milk factory to close down. RIP Miltank, what an absolute unit.
After this, Mamoswine comes in to clean house with Ice Beam + Ice Shard.

Mistakes were definitely made here. Mostly that I lost a lot of utility because of the fight vs. Bruno. I probably could've also shaved losing Miltank vs. Lance. That said, we're still living. I'm not sure how to rebuild from here, but I have some options.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53043330
Hey, that's cool. I was just curious since the threads here always seems collector focus.

Radiant Pokemon are Pokemon that you can only have one of in your deck, but they're have powerful effects or attacks. So it's fun to try and choose which Radiant you want to use or work into your deck. Pic rel is one of the most popular ones, discard pile setup and drawing is really good for a lot of decks.

Radiant Eternatus is the main new one from CZ people like. When you bench it, you can search your deck for any two VMAX Pokemon and bench them as well. Which opens up a lot of opportunities for faster VMAX play.

>I was surprised people can just join games without even having the mod
The game is just a sandbox, when you sub to a workshop you're just getting a .json file telling the game to load different images, models, etc
Anybody that joins will just load the same information, the game will actually download these assets to make loading faster but if you don't want to clog your disk space turn Mod Cache off in the options.

>perhaps there should be a Steam group or something for Pokemon matchmaking
There probably is, lots of TTS discords popped up after the death of Global Chat, a shame. You could also host a lobby and post the info here so other anons can join. I don't play much these days but doing drafted/booster deck matches could be fun.

I tend to run heavy on bosses orders and path to the peak for this reason. Being able to get that stadium out and rotate in the genesects will get you some good prizes. >questy
Popular quest writer who got his start here and spawned a few copycats who were infinitely more autistic

iirc this was a comic drawn here by a webcomic artist, maybe have been a nuzlocke comic but probably wasn't. Used tumblr humor and shipped Black with N because the artist was a yaoi fangirl
>Hajime/N is an angel
Early /vp/ rumors from when BW had just released in Japan about scrapped events left in first-print runs of the games
>Shocky
Furry shitposter who really liked Raichu
>Garyraids
If a thread was shit, anons would spam it with pics of Gary Oak. Most commonly called Garybombing
>no es fake/Fairy-type denial
Spanish anons and anons in general were very adamant about no new type being introduced in XY, but they were irrevocably rekt
>Boogie/vanilla icing
Pokephile artist who would frequent the board when porn was allowed. He had actually decent technical skill and even posted photoshop tutorials. Most famous for drawing art of waifumons shitting vanilla frosting onto food
>Serebii confirmed
This one is about Joe Serebii von Merrick, owner of serebi.net, and how anons used to claim every rumor was fake unless he posted about it
>r u simgle master?
Vintage shitpost of posting a pokemon, often Vaporeon, with this line as the thread text
>Yoink!
Didn't start on /vp/
>Library-chan
Old namefag of little renown

We really need to define what exactly is iceberg material to begin with before doing this OP. As far as I know, iceberg infographics are used to show people dark and dubious secrets of the internet that not many people knows. The deeper the iceberg goes, the harder it is to find such information unless people dive deeper into the internet infrastructure. Many secrets can't be found on the surface (Google/search engines) while some can only be found in dubious imageboards or hobby websites (4chan/discord). The darkest secrets can only be uncovered by using TOR or P2P networks. This is how an iceberg should work

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Peak of the iceberg
Very well known facts. Things that you can find and read from Google search without clicking on the link.
>Platform of the iceberg
Well known facts. Things you can find and read from websites listed on google search.
>Water level surface
Known facts. Things and pages that are being promoted on wiki homepages.

^^Anything above this level must come from TPCi themselves.^^

>Below water level
Less known facts. Things that you can find after clicking several layers of links from initial page that you originally clicked from google or wiki.
>Stem of the iceberg
Lesser known facts. Things that are being spoken regularly on imageboards, blogs, reddit, discord, etc.

vvMost (if not all) of stuffs below this level are +18 stuffs.vv

>Twilight zone
Not well known facts. Things that seldom being shared on degenerate imageboards such as /vp/. If you ask a typical pokemon fan, they may or may not know about them.
>Bottom of the iceberg
Mostly rumours. Things that rarely being talked about. Things that lack verifiable sources. You will never read about these things on wiki pages and their topics are highly regulated by admins.
>Below the iceberg
Mysterious rumours. No one knows how they started or where did they come from. Once in a while, someone will mention them on imageboards like 4chan. But there is absolutely no way to find and verify their sources.

>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

>Wiki
https://pokeclicker.miraheze.org/wiki/Home_Page

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Why would you ever want to remove a vitamin

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53054649
Vitamins only benefit the pokemon when it is hatched.
What good is a vitamin on a pokemon, if you don't hatch that egg anymore?
It doesn't do anything but change the time, and points you get from hatching pokemon.

Meaning removing it, won't do anything to the pokemon's stats, unless you want to start hatching the eggs again.

Its good they allow you to reallocate it to a pokemon of which can make better use of it for your hatching habits.

>>53088738
Ash and Serena both have similar core values as people. In other words, their behaviors, motivations, and actions can subconsciously end up being the same. Here are a few examples:

They put others before themselves - Ash and Serena are both very selfless individuals. There are many instances where Ash or Serena steps in to help out a person or Pokémon in need. For Ash, there are multiple instances of this across the anime's history. From protecting Pikachu from the wild Spearow in the very first episode, to helping out other abandoned Pokémon like Charmander and Chimchar, and even gaining the trust of his Charizard, Ash has shown that he puts his friends before himself multiple times. For Serena, she goes in mud in XY021 to save her Fennekin, she offers to stay back and watch over Bonnie in XY036, she risks her chance of skipping a performance round in favor of finding her lost Eevee in XY091, Serena comforts Eevee the night before its first performance in XY101, and she offers on her own to help Mairin find Chespie in XY133. Both Ash and Serena are able to put others before themselves, and it shows that they feel strong empathy to the ones around them.

posts.com: They are able to speak up for themselves - Ash and Serena stand up for themselves when they believe in something, and take action towards what they want to do. Some Ash examples include when he speaks up and says he's worried about his Butterfree after trading it to the gentlemen for his Raticate in EP015, when he turns down Scott's offer to become a Frontier Brain in AG190, when he argues with Skyla over her "sky battles" in BW067, and when he stands up to Lysandre in XY133. Some Serena examples include when she speaks up to her mother about her performer dream in XY053, when she declines Palermo's offers in both XY113 and XY138, when she decides to go find and talk to Ash in XY121, and when she thanks Ash and kisses him in XY140. These actions show that Ash and Serena are not just doormats, and that they both care a lot about making a difference when they make their voices heard.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: They both are optimistic and excitable - Both characters have a lot of energy to them, and they love to stay upbeat and keep a positive attitude when they can. For Ash, he is typically positive throughout the anime's history. From running over to Professor Oak's lab the day he receives Pikachu, to becoming excited about the Hoenn region from Harrison, to reuniting with his Charizard in Unova, and his determination to beat Leon, Ash gets optimistic and energetic about a lot of events in his life. For Serena, she is upbeat and excited when she changes her look in XY060, despite just having come out of an emotional breakdown. Serena is also upbeat and supportive of helping out Jessie with Dr. White in XY063. Serena becomes cheerful and runs to Gloire City at the end of XY109, despite having a hard time sleeping the night before. In the same episode, Serena also cheers up her Pokemon by giving them food, boosting their morale. Serena is also optimistic in XY115, when she dresses as Ash, showing how pumped she is to battle as Ash in his place. Lastly, she happily tells Mairin in XY129 that she can help her with whatever she needs. Overall, there are a lot of moments throughout the anime where both Ash and Serena have a sunny disposition, and want to make everyone surrounding them happier and more confident.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
This is a letter from a Pokeshipper to Amourshippers and other Pokeshippers.

I grew up with Misty as part of the core trio, she was both basically my first fictional crush and then part of my personal OTP. I still think Misty works better with Ash than other girls in the anime (except Dawn, who I think is a really good character).

I can get pretty defensive about this ship, because it means a lot to me. And I admit, I don't really care about Serena's character. I don't like her and the XY era of the anime was the reason I stopped watching the anime for ages, only watching it occasionally, until Journeys.

But that's my opinion. Just like I have every right to gush about my favorite Pokegirl, XY stans have a right to gush about theirs.

But more often than not, gushing about Misty attracts Serena's fans ready to ruin every conversation about her with toxicity.

Unfortunately, the same happens when Amourshippers gush about Serena and some Pokeshippers appear and bring toxicity in those posts.

I know this is practically a lost cause, but every interactions has devolved into an all out war. Just yesterday I was called stupid because I explained why I didn't ship Ash and Serena while shipping Ash and Misty (while somehow this particular guy claims that Pokeshippers are NaruSaku shippers because Ash and Serena is NaruHina? I don't know, I didn't understand the logic)

I, for one, would like to offer an olive (Smoliv? Dolliv? Arboliva?) branch to Amourshippers.

Let's just enjoy those final 11 episodes of Ash. I know I was lucky that my favorite Pokegirl will be present to 10 of those episodes, I honestly wasn't expecting this when I thought that Ash was leaving the anime at the start of Journey, expecting her to be a glorified cameo.

I seriously hope that Amourshippers and XY fans get an episode as good as the one with Misty was for me.

We all know no ship will get canonized, and honestly, I'm fine with that. Let's all just calm down.

Signed: A Pokeshipper.

posts.com: They both can be hard on themselves when they feel bad - There have been plenty of instances where Ash or Serena feel bad about something, and mull over it, showing their sensitive sides. For Ash, he stayed in bed feeling depressed about his loss to Ritchie in EP080, Ash was in a slump after his full battle against Paul in DP133, he was depressed after losing to Wulfric in XY121, and he was in a slump from going down the PWC rankings in JN036. For Serena, she cried after losing her first showcase in XY060 due to feeling like everything she worked towards was for nothing, she snapped at her Pokémon and still needed space to get over her prior loss in XY064, she had a hard time falling asleep after Palermo told her she was lacking something in XY109, and she heavily regretted getting mad at Ash in XY121. These scenes show that they are very passionate people, and they take themselves seriously when something matters and goes wrong. Ash and Serena care a lot about making things better for themselves.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: They are both creative thinkers - Ash and Serena love to think outside of the box to solve a lot of their situations. A lot of examples for Ash happen during his battles, like his Rock Tomb climb against Grant, Pikachu using a wood chip against Sawyer's Aegislash, and using Greninja's knives as ice skates against Wulfric. Outside of battles, there's also examples like Serena telling Ash that his Pokémon think just like he does in XY059, which leads to him thinking about his love for food, and he gathers berries as a result. There's also Ash using his bond phenomenon with Greninja in XY139 to sense its location. There's some examples for Serena as well. When Clemont tries to figure out where his Shinx is in XY048, Serena suggests that it could have evolved into Luxio, which Clemont says that Serena may have a point. Sere also improvises and fixes her skirt in XY060, showing that she has quick thinking under pressure and enough talent to fix her problem efficiently. In XY083, Serena makes a connection between the Mamoswine Ash is riding and her Rhyhorn Racing experience, and offers to take over on piloting the Mamoswine, to great success. Serena also crafted an extra space in Bonnie's bag just for Squishy in XY094. Overall, when push comes to shove, Ash and Serena can both have brilliant ideas on the spot, and have the talent to execute those ideas as well.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: They are both sensitive and considerate - Ash and Serena can be mindful of each other, as well as those around them. One example is in XY022, when Ash notices that Serena looks confused and asks her what's wrong, which leads to Serena saying that she's never fished before. Ash then teaches Serena how to fish. Another example is in XY090, when Serena looks down and clenches her fist during the tag battle, which Ash notices and says Serena's name in worry. In XY103, Serena tucks Bonnie to bed after Bonnie got worried about losing Squishy. This leads to Serena understanding why Bonnie got upset, and showing empathy towards Bonnie's fears of losing Squishy. In XY109, Serena notices that her Sylveon is upset, understanding it's frustration due to Serena's previous mistakes in her performances, and comforts it by saying to enjoy its dance and have fun on stage. In XY118, Serena gives Ash a water bottle after Ash trained with his Greninja, with Serena being considerate of how exhausted Ash got from the training. There's also XY138, where Ash can sense Serena's uneasiness, and offers to battle her to help clear her head, then gives her advice to cheer her up. Overall, both Ash and Serena are pure hearted individuals with honest motivations. They stay honest with each other and their friends, they hear each other out, they feel strongly about their emotions, and their empathy for those around them is powerful.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: They both inspire those around them, while remaining humble - One of the reasons I support Amourshipping is because it embraces the idea of a power couple. Both Ash and Serena want to keep improving themselves to make their world a better place, and one way of going about that is impacting the people in their lives. For Ash, one of the first people that really looked up to him was Ritchie. Despite Ritchie defeating Ash in the Indigo League, Ritchie really came to respect Ash as a person, and they both shared their dreams of becoming Pokémon Masters. As Ash becomes more successful over time, we see that he inspires more and more people. Paul, Trip, Sawyer, Alain, Gladion, Kiawe, and even trainers like Cynthia and Leon all eventually gain respect for him, and become inspired by him to do better themselves. At the same time, while Ash bragged about his Kanto badges early into his journey, he became very humble over time, never bragging about his accomplishments too much. He didn't even tell Goh immediately that he defeated Leon when Goh called him the next morning. As for Serena, we see that as she learns what it takes to become Kalos Queen, she starts to have an impact on the people around her. She cheers up Lumiose City from the aftermath of the Team Flare arc, she gains respect from characters like Palermo and Aria, and she inspires others like Mairin and Chloe. While Serena would eventually become successful by JN105, it's clear that she doesn't lose sight of who she is, and also doesn't brag about her accomplishments. Both Ash and Serena just want to make the people around them happy, and the world a better place.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Overall, Ash and Serena have a lot in common in terms of their mindset and way of doing things. Even though their careers are pretty different, they do have a common goal. Ash and Serena want to be the very best, like no one ever was! Ash and Serena have different ways of expressing themselves and climbing to the top, but their motivations for doing what they do are not so dissimilar after all. Amourshipping teaches us that it's okay if a couple has different hobbies and interests, because Ash and Serena can still get along just fine if they are happy to share their interests and goals with each other. In fact, it may even be better if their hobbies aren't exactly the same, as it would let Ash and Serena appreciate things that they may have not given much attention to otherwise, expanding both of their world views in the process. Overall, despite Serena not primarily being a battler, and Ash only doing a handful of contests himself, they can still enjoy each other's company and be happy with participating in each other's hobbies. Because, at the end of the day, Ash and Serena have a very similar outlook on life. They are both positive people with high energy, and have a lot to offer to the people around them. This is one of the many things that makes Amourshipping great to me.

I’ll be writing a couple more writeups throughout the week. Check back tomorrow for another one!

If I had to guess, one programmer at Game Freak seethed because the Legends Team picked Typhlosion instead of CHARIZARD for PLA. It can't even be that Typhlosion being made in a time before powercreep because Game Freak goes back and fixes old Pokemon all the time. For fucks sake, nearly every other returning Pokemon in SV got new coverage (off their higher offensive stat) or some useful utility moves. Delphox got Nasty Plot despite already being minmaxed as fuck, and Cinderace got Swords Dance despite already being one of the most bullshit pokemon ever even before it got its special snowflake Protean rip off that doesn't even make sense for it. >Why was the chief repeating this again?
>Everyone knew what happened.
>Was he just rubbing it in?
>"Gotta say, you did one helluva job on that house."
>"That aura sphere a'yours demolished that wall, hoo boy."
>He tapped the photograph of the aftermath, as if you needed a reminder.
>The whole side of the house was blown inward.
>"Exactly three point two seconds later, you KO'd his pet umbreon and had the man in a headlock."
>The chief shook his head dismissively.
>"Good thing you didn't snap the poor lad's neck."
>You winced at the thought of killing an innocent man.
>It's your fault.
>You trusted command got the address right without double-checking.
>"Well, missy, let's all say a big thank you to the big man upstairs, 'cause nothin' short of a miracle just happened."
"Sir?" The timid Lucairo replied.
>"This was nothing short of a slam dunk case against us. No lawyer could've messed this up if they tried."
>"Turns out, Mr. Anon's a very forgiving man."
>For the first time in weeks, your ears perked up in hope.
>"Won't bore you with the legalese, but here's the jist of it."
>"The man could've bankrupted the department twice over, but all he's asking for are some repairs and remodeling. And paying the pet's poke-center bill too."
>"That is, on one condition. And that's why you're here."
>You sat up straighter, eager to help.
>"Bizarre as it may seem, you're our bargaining chip."
>"He insisted you keep your job, first off."
>"Can't say the same for others involved in this clown show."
>"Second, he wants to get to know you better."
>"Wants you to train him, can you believe it?"
>"Says he wanted to meet you a couple hours each day to exercise. And it could only be you."
>You said a silent 'thank you' to Arceus.
>"Now, look, the whole deal rides on this. Made it damn clear there's no alternative."
>"We're all losing our jobs if you don't do it."
>"Now, I can't make you..."
>You didn't hesitate. You nodded furiously.
>"Atta girl."
>"Here's his new address."

Inject - Shitpost - Circlejerk

This thread is for Hacks and/or Clones. Come in and get free stuff!

Try to keep requests simple, don't ask for a thousand Pokemon at once. Injectors can only work so fast.

Keep Injections, hacks, clones, etc. in this thread please.

>Is this thread legit or not?
It is very legit. People will post here to try to tell you otherwise. Ignore them.

>No one has fulfilled my request yet? Why?
Injectors fulfill requests out of the goodness of their own hearts, and on their own time. Be patient.

>How can I help the process go faster?
Use PKHex to create .PK9 files to help Injectors quickly load in the pokemon you want. Follow the guide.
PKHeX Guide by IZIX:
https://pastebin.com/WaBxNECx (embed) (embed) (embed) (embed) (embed) (embed)

>What's the difference between this thread and Wi-Fi General?
Wi-Fi General does not condone hacks, and asking for or offering a hack over there will result in a completely unnecessary shitstorm. Play the game however you want, but if you want injections/genned Pokémon, play here in a more friendly, less autistic environment

SV bothers me because it just reminds so much of what we lost. It is actually a good game, but all of that is hidden beneath so much dredge. Like it's fun to run around and battle stuff, I actually enjoy raids and online is fun. But all of that single player content that I kept coming back to everyday isn't really there. And it makes me sad at how much potential this game actually has to be great, not just good. I've gotten so used to Pokémon games being underwhelming lately that I forget we used to actually have content like dungeons, mini games, post game rematches and legendary battles... Some of that stuff is in this game, but it's so half-assed it doesn't feel as rewarding. HGSS and Generation 5 really were the peak of the series, and I know I'll get hate for saying that but they were. Generation 6 was the last time they even bothered to implement a lot of stuff. I think once generation 7 came around, they realized that they could just focus on the main campaign and that's all they had to worry about. There wasn't anything left to entice you to keep playing beyond like a post game story. It sucks. That whole sense of wonder is really missing from these games now.

>>53087548
>sure is weird how SV is a "barren empty hellscapes" even though I can actually see Pokemon in the world while I can't in gen 5.
Either you're dumb or you are purposely choosing to misunderstand and misinterpret what the other person was saying. They're not referring to whether or not Pokémon are present on the overworld. They're talking about the fact that on any given route in the 2D games, especially of the DS era, there was that hard to define SOUL present. When you entered a forest, there were branching paths and you couldn't see everything at once so it really felt like a mystery. You didn't know what was going to jump out at you from the tall grass or whether a trainer would spot you. You also had to wonder where the hidden pokeballs were and if there was a legendary tucked away that you couldn't quite get to yet because you didn't have the correct HM or missed a certain path. In SV, especially this game, but also other 3D games, you can kind of go anywhere and you can kind of see anything so there's no real mystery. Yes you can still explore, but there's no real detail in the environments And because it's a 3D game it's pretty easy to tell where the hidden caves are or what's important to come back to. It doesn't feel the same at all and there's something preferable in the 2D era
